name: Coronado
shortDescription: Iconic island community with pristine beaches, historic Hotel del Coronado, and small-town charm.
fullDescription: Coronado offers luxurious coastal living with its famous white-sand beaches, Orange Avenue shopping district, and breathtaking views of the San Diego skyline. Connected to downtown by the Coronado Bridge, this island community maintains a charming small-town feel with upscale amenities and naval history.

neighborhoods.name: San Diego
neighborhoods.description: Major metropolitan center across the bay with employment hubs and cultural attractions.
neighborhoods.imageAlt: San Diego skyline viewed from the bay

neighborhoods.name: Imperial Beach
neighborhoods.description: Southernmost beach city with laidback surf town vibe and pier.

neighborhoods.name: National City
neighborhoods.description: Urban community with cultural diversity and waterfront parks.

neighborhoods.name: La Mesa
neighborhoods.description: Inland city east of San Diego known for its walkable downtown village and neighborhood charm.

highlights.title: World-Famous Beaches
highlights.description: Coronado Beach consistently ranked among America's best with sparkling white sand.

highlights.title: Historic Hotel Del
highlights.description: Iconic Victorian beach resort dating back to 1888 with famous oceanfront dining.
highlights.bgImageAlt: Coronado shoreline near Hotel del Coronado

highlights.title: Orange Avenue Charm
highlights.description: Walkable downtown with boutique shops, cafes and small-town ambiance.

highlights.title: Naval History
highlights.description: Home to Naval Air Station North Island with rich military heritage.
highlights.bgImageAlt: San Diego Bay and marina near NAS North Island

faqs.question: What are the best neighborhoods in Coronado?
faqs.answer: Popular areas include the Village near Orange Avenue, Coronado Cays waterfront community, and Gold Coast historic district.

faqs.question: How is the real estate market in Coronado?
faqs.answer: One of Southern California's most exclusive markets with historic cottages and luxury waterfront estates.

faqs.question: What is there to do in Coronado?
faqs.answer: Enjoy the beach, Hotel Del, downtown shopping, biking the island, and ferry to downtown San Diego.

faqs.question: How is commuting to downtown San Diego?
faqs.answer: 5-10 minutes via Coronado Bridge or take the scenic ferry across the bay.

acceptedAnswer.text: Coronado offers a unique island lifestyle with world-class beaches, historic charm, and small-town feel just minutes from downtown San Diego.
